stories.title: The Definitive Guide That You Never Wanted: Backpack Fabrics

stories.text:
WheelsTV, a SaaS-based video technology company serving automotive dealerships, is looking for a long-term technical resource to maintain our legacy system and support our new projects. You will be the lead developer and have the chance to design and implement software solutions to solve complex problems. We're looking for strong starters who place less emphasis on planning and more emphasis on building.

We are building into the future today with a Laravel Doctrine-based HATEOAS API, but we need to continue to support our Phpfox-based tools. Phpfox is a closed-source framework we chose to build on to manage our library of automotive videos. Similar to CakePHP, learning this framework and the application built on top of it is necessary for long-term maintenance.

Our new initiative is a consolidated database of our videos in a Doctrine ORM and Laravel 8 set of APIs. This has been developed and is just coming online. The ability to manage this database using the application tools we have created will be part of this position.

Role • Responsible for the video technology player integration onto auto dealership websites • Video encoding, shipping videos, and managing virtual assistants for cue points • Manage Fibre SAN systems/storage solutions • Provide 1st and 2nd level technical support to auto dealerships and website

You're good at and can: Manage SaaS platform on AWS Develop and maintain features Encode and manage video content Provide support for existing customer integrations SQL Data Managment PHP with ~2014 framework experience AWS - S3 and virtual machines Video Rendering - the ability to convert video resolutions and file types Experience working as part of a small team (< 5) BS degree in Computer Science or related field Strong experience with HTML, CSS Experience with Adobe Premiere Pro, Adobe Media Encoder and Adobe Photoshop OS X System Administration experience Solid knowledge of Amazon Web Services Knowledge of various encoding codec's Solid web design, layout, typography and iconography skills Has worked with A/B Testing methods. Understands how to view data. Knowledge of Digital Marketing Technologies Excellent verbal and written communication skills and presentation experience Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), G Suite (Google Docs, Google Sheets). Automotive industry experience a plus

Bonus Skills: CakePHP Brightcove Spreadsheet import and export of SQL results Data-mapper pattern ORM experience

Competitive compensation & equity package Location: Greater Boston, MA But will consider remote Check out www.wheelstv.net for more details! If interested, please send an email to chris@wheelstv.net. We look forward to hearing from you!

Why you may enjoy working at WheelsTV: As the lead developer, you will design and implement software solutions to solve complex problems for car shoppers. You will have the opportunity to use your development skills to develop and demonstrate disruptive and transformational products as part of an agile development team. We're looking for strong starters who place less emphasis on planning and more emphasis on building.

You want to be part of a collaborative team: experience heads-down coding time and active participation in creativity and product design. You want to directly work with the business, marketing, and user experience teams and be involved with day-to-day product decision-making. You are passionate about building and iterating on software prototypes and have a start-up mentality. You may also enjoy building custom algorithms, digging into data for insights, building engaging interfaces, and always looking to sharpen your skills with emerging interactive video technology.
